<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 373, 368, 388]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 397, 680, 412]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 412, 304, 426]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 426, 480, 440]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 440, 480, 454]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 453, 364, 467]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 478, 270, 492]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 492, 789, 521]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 520, 562, 534]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 534, 576, 548]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 558, 576, 572]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 572, 722, 586]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 586, 420, 600]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 69, 567, 85]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 157, 531, 173]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 186, 222, 203]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 214, 359, 231]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\),  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 233, 556, 265]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}.\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 286, 210, 301]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[232, 305, 715, 343]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 350, 470, 387]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 447, 562, 464]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[74, 477, 146, 494]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 505, 546, 523]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 530, 546, 548]]<|/det|>
\[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 555, 560, 572]]<|/det|>
\[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[74, 599, 223, 615]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 621, 562, 650]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 670, 564, 688]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 695, 531, 724]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 75, 91, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 72, 720, 98]]<|/det|>
Given that \(7^{x} \times 49^{y} = 1\) and \(5^{5x} \times 125^{\frac{2y}{3}} = \frac{1}{25}\) , calculate the value of \(x\) and of \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 75, 876, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[220, 92, 430, 112]]<|/det|>

<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 67, 138, 85]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 66, 875, 100]]<|/det|>
Jess wants to arrange 9 different books on a shelf. There are 4 mathematics books, 3 physics books and 2 chemistry books. Find the number of different possible arrangements of the books if

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 112, 171, 129]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[185, 112, 359, 129]]<|/det|>
there are no restrictions,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 112, 876, 129]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[141, 241, 171, 259]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[185, 241, 499, 259]]<|/det|>
a chemistry book is at each end of the shelf,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 241, 876, 259]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[136, 427, 171, 445]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[183, 427, 803, 445]]<|/det|>
all the mathematics books are kept together and all the physics books are kept together.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 427, 876, 445]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 67, 141, 84]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 67, 875, 101]]<|/det|>
A quiz team of 6 children is to be chosen from a class of 8 boys and 10 girls. Find the number of ways of choosing the team if

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 112, 171, 129]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[183, 112, 359, 129]]<|/det|>
there are no restrictions,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 112, 876, 129]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[141, 242, 171, 259]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[183, 242, 485, 259]]<|/det|>
there are more boys than girls in the team.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 242, 876, 259]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 72, 875, 123]]<|/det|>
